    public class MyHTTPHandler1_0
extends AbstractHTTPHandler
    Implements an handler that serves HTTP/1.0 requests.
    Author:
    Simone Cipriani, 5951907

      • implementGET

        HTTPReply implementGET(java.lang.String url)
                throws HTTPProtocolException
        A basic implementation of the HTTP/1.0 GET method.
        Parameters:
        url - of the requested resource
        Returns:
        a reply with the resource fetched as a body
        Throws:
        MyHTTPProtocolException - if anything bad with resource fetching (I.E. Not Found)
        HTTPProtocolException

      • implementHEAD

        HTTPReply implementHEAD(java.lang.String url)
                 throws HTTPProtocolException
        A basic implementation of the HTTP/1.0 HEAD method.
        Parameters:
        url - of the request
        Returns:
        an HTTPReply indicating success or failure
        Throws:
        HTTPProtocolException - if it is not possible to construct the HTTPReply

      • implementPOST

        HTTPReply implementPOST(java.lang.String path,
                        java.lang.String body)
                 throws HTTPProtocolException
        A basic implementation of the HTTP/1.0 POST method. It does not do anything useful, just append to the resource indicated in path the body of the request. More "realistic" implementations can be done, but I think it is out of the scope of this project.
        Parameters:
        path - of the request
        body - of the request
        Returns:
        an HTTPReply indicating success or failure
        Throws:
        HTTPProtocolException - if it is not possible to construct the HTTPReply
